display.label: Microsoft Dynamics 365
display.description: Query, create, update or delete Microsoft Dynamics 365 API records

inputs.comments: Your organization's Microsoft Dynamics 365 Web API URL.
inputs.label: Web API URL

inputs.comments: The OAuth 2.0 Authorization URL for Microsoft Dynamics 365.
inputs.label: Authorize URL

inputs.comments: The OAuth 2.0 Token URL for Microsoft Dynamics 365.
inputs.label: Token URL

inputs.comments: A space-delimited set of one or more scopes to get the user's permission to access.
inputs.label: Scopes

documentation.description:
The OAuth 2.0 auth code flow allows your user grant permission to your integration to interact with Dynamics on their behalf.

1. Log in to [Azure Portal](https://portal.azure.com/)
1. Select **App registrations**
1. Click **+ New registration**
   - **Supported account types** should be **Multi-tenant** if you intend for customers to authenticate with their own Dynamics instance, or **Single-tenant** if you intend to authenticate with your own Dynamics instance.
   - Under **Redirect URI** enter https<!---->://oauth2.prismatic.io/callback
   - Click **Register**
1. Under **API permissions** click **+Add a permission**
   - Select **Dynamics CRM**
   - Check the `user_impersonation` permission
   - Click **Add permissions**
1. Under **Certificates & secrets** click **+ New client secret**
   - Give your certificate a description and expiration date
   - Take note of the **value** (not the Secret ID) of the client secret.
1. Returning to the **Overview** page, take note of **Application (client) ID**

Within Prismatic, create a connection of type **MS Dynamics OAuth 2.0 Auth Code**.

- Enter the **Client ID** and **Secret Value** you noted above.
- Log in to Dynamics and take note of the Dynamics URL.
  - Enter that Dynamics URL as the **Web API URL**. It should look like `https://REPLACE-ME.crm.dynamics.com/`
  - Under scopes, enter the following, replacing the URL with your Dynamics URL: `https://REPLACE-ME.crm.dynamics.com/user_impersonation offline_access`

connections.label: MS Dynamics OAuth 2.0 Client Credentials
connections.comments: OAuth 2.0 Client Credentials Connectivity for Microsoft Dynamics

inputs.comments: Your organization's Microsoft Dynamics 365 Web API URL.
inputs.label: Web API URL

inputs.comments: This can be found by visiting your app in Azure portal and selecting 'Endpoints'
inputs.label: Token URL

inputs.comments: This should be your Dynamics URL with '/.default' appened to it
inputs.label: Scopes

inputs.comments: Generated when you register an app in Azure portal
inputs.label: Client ID

inputs.comments: Generated when you register an app in Azure portal
inputs.label: Client secret value

documentation.description:
The OAuth 2.0 client credentials flow allows your user to create an **Application User** to send requests to Dynamics on their behalf.
Setting up a client credentials connection is a two-step process:

1. Create an "App" in Azure
1. Create an "Application User" in Dynamics

#### Create an app in Microsoft Azure

1. Log in to [Azure Portal](https://portal.azure.com/)
1. Select **App registrations**
1. Click **+ New registration**
   - **Supported account types** can be **Single tenant**
   - No **Redirect URI** is necessary
   - Click **Register**
1. Under **API permissions** click **+Add a permission**
   - Select **Dynamics CRM**
   - Check the `user_impersonation` permission
   - Click **Add permissions**
1. Under **API permissions** click **Grant admin concent for (your org)**
1. Under **Certificates & secrets** click **+ New client secret**
   - Give your certificate a description and expiration date
   - Take note of the **value** (not the Secret ID) of the client secret.
1. Returning to the **Overview** page, take note of **Application (client) ID**
1. From the **Overview** page, click **Endpoints** and take note of the **OAuth 2.0 token endpoint (v2)**

You will use the **Secret Value**, **Client ID** and **Token Endpoint** in a moment.

#### Add the app as an App User to Dynamics

1. Log in to [Power Platform admin center](https://admin.powerplatform.microsoft.com/)
1. Select **Environments** and choose your Dynamics Environments
1. Select **S2S Apps**
1. Click **+New app user**
   - Click **+Add an app**
   - Choose the app you created in Azure portal (above). You can search for your app by entering the client ID you noted.
   - Select your Dynamics tenant as your **Business unit**
   - Under **Security Roles** select **System Administrator**
   - Click **Create**

#### Configure the connection in Prismatic

Within Prismatic, create a connection of type **MS Dynamics OAuth 2.0 Client Credentials**.

- Enter the **Token Endpoint** you noted as your **Token URL**.
- Enter the **Client ID** and **Secret Value** you noted above.
- Log in to Dynamics and take note of the Dynamics URL.
  - Enter that Dynamics URL as the **Web API URL**. It should look like `https://REPLACE-ME.crm.dynamics.com/`
  - Under scopes, enter the Dynamics URL with `.default` appended to it - `https://REPLACE-ME.crm.dynamics.com/.default`

display.label: [CRM] Query Attributes
display.description: Query for CRM Attributes that satisfy the filter expression

inputs.comments: The ID of a specific Entity record
inputs.label: Entity ID

inputs.comments: The type of Attribute to query
inputs.label: Attribute Type

inputs.comments: The names of the fields to retrieve
inputs.label: Field Name

inputs.comments: The filter expression that used for querying entity collections
inputs.example: Country_Region_Code eq 'ES' and Payment_Terms_Code eq '14 DAYS'
inputs.label: Filter Expression

inputs.comments: The names of entity properties to linked entities that should be included
inputs.label: Expand Property Name

display.label: [CRM] Query Entities
display.description: Query for Microsoft Dynamics 365 CRM entity records that satisfy the filter expression.

inputs.comments: The type of Entity to query, usually a pluralized name
inputs.label: Entity Type

inputs.comments: The names of the fields to retrieve
inputs.label: Field Name

inputs.comments: The filter expression that used for querying entity collections
inputs.example: Country_Region_Code eq 'ES' and Payment_Terms_Code eq '14 DAYS'
inputs.label: Filter Expression

inputs.comments: The names of the fields to order by
inputs.label: Order By Field Name

inputs.comments: The names of entity properties to linked entities that should be included
inputs.label: Expand Property Name

inputs.comments: The number of record to retrieve per page
inputs.label: Records Per Page

inputs.comments: The id or cookie to use for retrieving the next page of results when paginating through a large result set
inputs.label: Next Page Id

inputs.comments: The names of entity properties to linked entities that should be included

display.label: [CRM] Get Entities Metadata
display.description: A subset of Dynamics CRM Entity Types.

inputs.comments: The names of the Entity Types to default in a selected state.
inputs.label: Default Selected Entity Types

inputs.comments: The names or labels of the Entity Types to include; if blank then all types are included. Uses case-insensitive matching.
inputs.label: Entity Type Filter

inputs.comments: When true, will include all Custom Entity Types, even those not included in Record Type Name Filter.
inputs.label: Include All Custom Entity Types

inputs.comments: When true, will include only Entity Types that are top-level, meaning not subtypes of other Types, regardless of other filters.
inputs.label: Include Only Top Level Record Types

display.label: [CRM] Get Entity Metadata
display.description: Get definition of Microsoft Dynamics 365 CRM entity.

inputs.comments: The type of Entity to retrieve metadata for. Use the singular name here
inputs.label: Entity Type

display.label: [CRM] Batch Entity Actions
display.description: Perform multiple create/update/delete actions on Microsoft Dynamics 365 CRM entity records.

inputs.comments: A list of actions to perform on the entity records.
inputs.label: Batch Actions

display.label: [CRM] Run Fetch XML Query
display.description: Execute a fetch XML query against your Microsoft Dynamics 365 CRM instance.

inputs.comments: The type of Entity to query, usually a pluralized name
inputs.label: Entity Type

inputs.comments: An XML query string to use as a Fetch query in Microsoft Dynamics 365
inputs.label: XML Query

inputs.comments: Specifies annotations to include with the result
inputs.label: Include Annotations

inputs.comments: The page number to request
inputs.label: Page Number

inputs.comments: The id or cookie to use for retrieving the next page of results when paginating through a large result set
inputs.label: Next Page Id

inputs.comments: Specifies the GUID of a user to impersonate when executing the query
inputs.label: Impersonate User Id

display.label: [CRM] Get Current User
display.description: Get information about the currently logged in CRM user

display.label: [CRM] Raw Request
display.description: Send a raw request to Microsoft Dynamics 365 CRM

inputs.comments: Input the path only (/api/data/v9.2/accounts?$select=name), The base URL is already included (https://my-org.api.crm.dynamics.com). For example, to connect to https://my-org.api.crm.dynamics.com/api/data/v9.2/accounts?$select=name, only /api/data/v9.2/accounts?$select=name is entered in this field.
inputs.label: URL

inputs.comments: The HTTP method to use.
inputs.label: Method

inputs.comments: The HTTP body payload to send to the URL.
inputs.label: Data

inputs.comments: The Form Data to be sent as a multipart form upload.
inputs.label: Form Data

inputs.comments: File Data to be sent as a multipart form upload.
inputs.label: File Data

inputs.comments: A list of query parameters to send with the request. This is the portion at the end of the URL similar to ?key1=value1&key2=value2.
inputs.label: Query Parameter

inputs.comments: A list of headers to send with the request.
inputs.label: Header

inputs.comments: The type of data you expect in the response. You can request json, text, or binary data.
inputs.label: Response Type

inputs.comments: The maximum time that a client will await a response to its request
inputs.label: Timeout

inputs.comments: Enabling this flag will log out the current request.
inputs.label: Debug Request

inputs.comments: The delay in milliseconds between retries.
inputs.label: Retry Delay (ms)

inputs.comments: If true, retries on all erroneous responses regardless of type.
inputs.label: Retry On All Errors

inputs.comments: The maximum number of retries to attempt.
inputs.label: Max Retry Count

inputs.comments: Specifies whether to use a pre-defined exponential backoff strategy for retries.
inputs.label: Use Exponential Backoff

display.label: Raw Request
display.description: Send a raw HTTP request to Microsoft Dynamics 365 API

inputs.comments: Input the path only (/api/data/v9.2/accounts?$select=name), The base URL is already included (https://my-org.api.crm.dynamics.com). For example, to connect to https://my-org.api.crm.dynamics.com/api/data/v9.2/accounts?$select=name, only /api/data/v9.2/accounts?$select=name is entered in this field.
inputs.label: URL

inputs.comments: The HTTP method to use.
inputs.label: Method

inputs.comments: The HTTP body payload to send to the URL.
inputs.label: Data

inputs.comments: The Form Data to be sent as a multipart form upload.
inputs.label: Form Data

inputs.comments: File Data to be sent as a multipart form upload.
inputs.label: File Data

inputs.comments: A list of query parameters to send with the request. This is the portion at the end of the URL similar to ?key1=value1&key2=value2.
inputs.label: Query Parameter

inputs.comments: A list of headers to send with the request.
inputs.label: Header

inputs.comments: The type of data you expect in the response. You can request json, text, or binary data.
inputs.label: Response Type

inputs.comments: The maximum time that a client will await a response to its request
inputs.label: Timeout

inputs.comments: Enabling this flag will log out the current request.
inputs.label: Debug Request

inputs.comments: The delay in milliseconds between retries.
inputs.label: Retry Delay (ms)

inputs.comments: If true, retries on all erroneous responses regardless of type.
inputs.label: Retry On All Errors

inputs.comments: The maximum number of retries to attempt.
inputs.label: Max Retry Count

inputs.comments: Specifies whether to use a pre-defined exponential backoff strategy for retries.
inputs.label: Use Exponential Backoff

documentation.description:
[Microsoft Dynamics 365](https://dynamics.microsoft.com/) is a product line of enterprise resource planning (ERP) and customer relationship management (CRM) intelligent business applications.
This component gives you the ability to query and modify records within the Microsoft Dynamics 365 platform.
